Flying to Poltava on a ballistic trajectory. Could be EW.
Disappeared
Disappeared
This was Russian S-300/400 air defence targeting Ukrainian fighter jets

I wrote about this during the previous attack, and I am doing it again now because its become clear. In recent strikes, Russia has clearly changed its tactics for carrying out large scale missile attacks on Ukraine involving Tu-95MS/Tu-160M strategic bombers.‚Ä¶
No missiles have been detected in Ukrainian airspace. The launch maneuvers were simulated with electronic warfare.

I'm aware of Deepstate's update on Kupyansk, and quite frankly I don't care.
Those who map UKRAINIAN advances based off a UKRAINIAN source who is under constant pressure from the SBU are naive at best, and propagandists at worst.
I'm not saying this map isn't correct, as the situation is indeed critical for Russian forces in the city, but we will need a lot more to say for certain that this is true.

Last night and this morning, another large-scale, combined Russian missile and drone attack was carried out on Ukraine.
Missiles launched:
~8 Kalibr cruise missiles launched from 1 "Buyan-M" corvette in Novorossiysk Bay, Krasnodar Krai. 
~6 Iskander-M ballistic missiles from OTRK installations.
~4 Iskander-K cruise missiles launched from OTRK installations near Kursk City, Kursk Oblast.
~4 Kinzhal hypersonic aeroballistic missiles launched from 4 MiG-31K fighters at their launch lines Rasskazovsky District, Tambov Oblast.
-----------------------
Ukrainian air defence work:
As of the time of writing, no interceptions are confirmed. 
-----------------------
The main targets for this strike were Ukrainian energy and gas infrastructure. The following was targeted:
KS-Ananyiv natural gas compressor station, Odesa Oblast (47.65324, 29.90993) by ~1 Kalibr and ~1 Kinzhal.
Kirovohrad Thermal Power Plant, Kirovohrad Oblast (48.52925, 32.24529) by ~2 Kalibrs and ~2 Kinzhals.
Mykolaiv Combined Heat and Power Plant, Mykolaiv Oblast (46.94906, 31.98705) by ~2 Iskander-Ks.
"Trykhaty" 330 kV electrical substation (47.12851, 31.81054) by ~1 Kalibr.
Odesa Thermal Power Plant (46.50294, 30.71428) by ~3 Iskander-Ms, ~2 Iskander-Ks and 1 Kalibr.
"Novoodeska" 330 kV electrical substation (46.45382, 30.38700) by ~3 Iskander-Ms and 1 Kalibrs.
"Artsyz" 330 kV electrical substation (45.99236, 29.44702) by ~2 Kalibrs.
-----------------------
Keep in mind, the numbers of missiles launched may be slightly higher than what I've listed, as the number of missiles detected is often lower than actual launches.

Some of the consequences of the combined Russian missile and drone attack on Odesa Oblast:
During last night's attack, the missiles targeted the Odesa Thermal Power Plant. The drones targeted both the thermal power plant, and a series of electrical substations around the city and in the region. 
Media 1 shows a large fire burning at one of Odesa's substations. 
Media 2 shows NASA FIRMS data indicating large fires at the Odesa Thermal Power Plant.
Media 3 shows a large fire burning at the "Artsyz" 330 kV electrical substation in southern Odesa Oblast.

Some of the consequences of the combined Russian missile and drone attack on Odesa Oblast:
During last night's attack, the missiles targeted the Odesa Thermal Power Plant. The drones targeted both the thermal power plant, and a series of electrical substations around the city and in the region. 
Media 1 shows a large fire burning at one of Odesa's substations. 
Media 2 shows NASA FIRMS data indicating large fires at the Odesa Thermal Power Plant.
Media 3 shows a large fire burning at the "Artsyz" 330 kV electrical substation in southern Odesa Oblast.
Clear footage showing the moment of a Russian Geran-2 drone strike on a cargo ship stationed at Odesa Port this evening.
Clear footage showing the moment of a Russian Geran-2 drone strike on a cargo ship stationed at Odesa Port this evening.
Aftermath of this strike
Aftermath of this strike

As a result of the combined strike on Odesa, Mykolaiv, and Kirovohrad Oblasts, emergency power outages have been introduced on top of the rolling blackouts. 
Many important power facilities have been switched to backup generators while work is underway to repair the damage. Power has returned to most of Odesa City for the time being.

Scenes from Mykolaiv City, which was targeted by Russian Iskander-K cruise missiles and Geran-2 drones. 
A fire can be seen burning at an unknown facility - possibly the combined heat and power plant.

Scenes from Mykolaiv City, which was targeted by Russian Iskander-K cruise missiles and Geran-2 drones. 
A fire can be seen burning at an unknown facility - possibly the combined heat and power plant.

Russian forces have captured the city of Siversk, Siversk direction, Donetsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~12,400.
Total land area: ~9.64 km¬≤.
The most recent fighting for Siversk lasted approximately 25 days, with the main part of the battle lasting just ~8 days.

Consequences of Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on the 110 kV electrical substation in the city of Pryluky, Chernihiv Oblast. Widespread power outages were reported in the area.
Coordinates: 50.57656, 32.35493

Consequences of Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on the 110 kV electrical substation in the city of Pryluky, Chernihiv Oblast. Widespread power outages were reported in the area.

Ukrainian forces have recaptured the village of Radkivka, Kupyansk direction, Kharkiv Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~39.
Total land area: ~0.15 km¬≤.
The fighting for Radkivka lasted approximately 6 months, 15 days.

Ukrainian forces have recaptured the village of Kindrashivka, Kupyansk direction, Kharkiv Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~836.
Total land area: ~2.44 km¬≤.
The fighting for Kindrashivka lasted approximately 6 months, 20 days.

Russia-Ukraine Strikes: Substations Down, Cargo Ship Hit, Oil Refinery Fire
On the night of December 11-12, Russia and Ukraine conducted another exchange of strikes. Russian forces launched 80 attack UAVs against Ukraine, while Ukrainian forces struck targets in Russia. According to official reports, Russian air defense destroyed 90 drones during the latter attack. Russia's main strike was focused on energy infrastructure, particularly in the Odesa region and the city of Pavlohrad. Ukrainian drones struck a major Yaroslavl oil refinery‚Äîcausing a fire‚Äîand targeted a residential building in Tver.
In Odesa, two substations were hit‚Äîone in the Kotovsky district and one in Cheremushky‚Äîleading to a partial power outage in the city. Additionally, a Turkish cargo ship in the port of Chornomorsk (Odesa region) was damaged. According to some reports, the vessel was transporting military cargo.
Read more 
HERE

Russian Army Has Already Secured Third Of Huliaipole (Videos)
On December 12, the Russian military expanded its control in Huliaipole in Zaporozhye, securing at least a third of the key city.
The Vostok [East] Group of Forces stormed the eastern and northeastern parts of the city, taking control of Peschanya Street, after crossing the Haichur River a day earlier. Within 24 hours, Russian troops managed to reach the Specialized School at the city center after capturing large parts of Mira, Velyka and Urozhaina streets.
Currently 30% of Huliaipole is under Russian control. Around 2,4 square kilometers within the city have been captured, according to preliminary reports.

Kyiv‚Äôs High-Stakes Strategy: Rumors of a ‚ÄúDirty Bomb‚Äù Resurface
New details have emerged about Kiev's secret activities. Why were spent nuclear fuel and protective equipment delivered to Ukraine? Senior Ukrainian officials are involved in preparations for a monstrous provocation.
Recently, the operational situation on the Ukrainian front has not favored Kiev. The army is suffering setbacks on key sections of the front, and human reserves are dwindling daily. Massive Russian drone strikes are destroying the rear infrastructure daily. Explosions can be heard at night in most regions of Ukraine. The difficult economic situation could become critical if the European Union stops providing sufficient subsidies.
The world community is no longer shocked by the current fighting in Ukraine as it was in 2022. The media's impact is waning. Many now view the Ukrainian people's role as martyrs, led by the indomitable President Volodymyr Zelensky, with irony. 
üëâ

Breakthrough In Huliaipole: Russian Army Bypasses Ukraine's Defenses 
Russian assault groups crossed the Haichur River from the ¬´Bochany¬ª district and advanced into Huliaipole's central quarters. Russian units established control over Yunakivka in Sumy. 
The European Union has decided to freeze Russian assets on its territory indefinitely.

British Combat Drones And U.S. Spy Planes: Syrian Airspace Now Fully Open For Coalition
A British combat drone and a U.S. spy plane were spotted on unusual flights over Syria, in another sign of the emerging partnership between the country‚Äôs Islamist-led Interim Government and the United States-led coalition.
According to air traffic data from Flightradar24 and other sources, an MQ-9B Protector combat drone of the Royal Air Force (RAF) entered the Syrian airspace in the area between the capital, and the central governorate of Homs from Lebanon.
Soon after the drone was spotted, a Beech King Air 350i with the registration N503DE was detected flying over the city of Aleppo in northern Syria.
Read more
